type.description: Visual style type of the chip

commonMistakes.mistake: Using V1 type values like 'bordered' or 'pill'
commonMistakes.correction: V2 uses semantic types: default, primary, success, warning, danger, info

styles.description: Additional styling variant for the chip

interactive.description: Makes chip clickable with hover/active states

closeButton.description: Shows close/remove button on the chip

selectedStatus.description: Whether the chip is in selected state

actionableLabel.description: Accessible label for the actionable chip

maxWidth.description: Maximum width of chip text before truncation

tagClick.description: Emitted when chip is clicked (for interactive chips)

click.description: Emitted when close button is clicked

exampleEnrichments.title: Interactive Chip with Selection
exampleEnrichments.description: Clickable chip that can be selected

exampleEnrichments.title: Removable Chip
exampleEnrichments.description: Chip with close button for removal
exampleEnrichments.code:
<InChips
  text="Tag Name"
  type="info"
  close-button
  actionable-label="Remove tag"
  @click="handleRemove"
/>

commonMistakes.solution: InChips V2 handles icons differently, check documentation for icon usage

commonMistakes.issue: @click is for close button, @tag-click is for chip body click
commonMistakes.solution: Use @tag-click for interactive chips, @click for close button action

bestPractices.practice: Use semantic types for status indication
bestPractices.description: Choose type based on meaning: success for positive, danger for negative, etc.
bestPractices.example: type="success" for confirmed items, type="danger" for errors

bestPractices.description: When using close-button, provide actionableLabel for screen readers

bestPractices.practice: Use styles prop for visual hierarchy
bestPractices.description: solid for primary actions, soft for secondary, outline for subtle
